definition: Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)/surname Shang
abbr. for 朝鮮|朝鲜[Chao2 xian3] Korea
imperial or royal court/government/dynasty/reign of a sovereign or emperor/court or assembly held by a sovereign or emperor/to make a pilgrimage to/facing/towards
morning

sentences.english: Youli was a jail as early as the Shang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 这羑里城在商朝的时候的确是一座监狱。

sentences.english: Jiang helped King Wen and his son turn over the Shang Dynasty and establish the Zhou Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 姜子牙协助文王及其子推翻商朝，建立周朝。

sentences.english: The Shang dynasty saw the discovery of bronze and the practice of sericulture .
sentences.chinese: 商朝时发现了青铜，开始学会养蚕。

sentences.english: The Shang Dynasty or Yin Dynasty was according to traditional sources the second Chinese dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 商朝或殷是根据传统来源王朝的第二个中国。

sentences.english: Bronze mirrors began to be used as early as the Shang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 早在商朝就开始使用青铜镜了。

sentences.english: What's inscribed on this tablet is a weather forecast during the Shang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 这块石碑上刻的就是一则商朝的天气预报。

sentences.english: During his reign, Tang lightened taxes and encouraged production to appease the morale.
sentences.chinese: 汤建立商朝后，减轻征赋，鼓励生产，安抚民心。

sentences.english: It means the ruins of the Shang Dynasty's capital.
sentences.chinese: 殷墟啊就是指商朝都城的遗址。

sentences.english: It was a capital of the Shang dynasty and one of the earliest centers of Chinese civilization.
sentences.chinese: 它是商朝的国都和中华文明的最早中心之一。

sentences.english: He was overthrown by Tang, the first king of the Shang dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 他被推翻后汤，第一金的商朝。

sentences.english: God in heaven that is to say, and Shang-feng come there.
sentences.chinese: 就是说天上神凤降临而商朝出现。

sentences.english: The dynasty Cheng Tang founded, the Shang, ruled China for over 600 years.
sentences.chinese: 成汤建立的商朝统治了中国600多年。

sentences.english: A long history spans between Shang Dynasty and Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 从商朝到清朝有很多年历史用英语咋说？

sentences.english: It was the prosperous capital city of the Shang Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 商朝在这里建立了繁华的都城。

sentences.english: Where is the original feud of the Shang nationality whose ancestor established Shang Dynasty?
sentences.chinese: 曾经建立了商朝的商族，其始祖契的始封地究在何处？

sentences.english: That must have been a road of the Shang Dynasty, right?
sentences.chinese: 那一定是商朝的马路，对不对？

definition: final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
Xia Dynasty (2070-1600 BC)
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
King Wu of Zhou (-1043), personal name Ji Fa 姬發|姬发, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 1046-1043 BC
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
Xia dynasty, unconfirmed but placed at c. 2070-c. 1600 BC
King Zhou of Shang (11th century BC), notorious as a cruel tyrant
the Zhou dynasty from 1027 BC
King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] overthrows tyrant Zhou of Shang 商紂王|商纣王[Shang1 Zhou4 wang2]
King Wu of Zhou, personal name Ji Fa, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 西周[Xi1 Zhou1] 1046-771 BC
Emperor Xin, last ruler of Shang (11th Century BC), famous as a tyrant

King Wen of Zhou state (c. 1152-1056 BC), reigned c. 1099-1056 BC as king of Zhou state, leading figure in building the subsequent Western Zhou dynasty, father of King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] the first Zhou dynasty king
Eastern Zhou (770-221 BC)
Wu Ding (c. 14th century BC), legendary founder and wise ruler of Shang dynasty
the prehistoric Shang dynasty (c. 16th-11th century BC)
Zhou dynasty (1046-221 BC)
